name: Njada Stonearm

other_aspects: Terrified of Being Weak (So She Acts Mean)

stunts: Stonearm: +2 to Physique when grappling, shoving, or holding someone in place.
Needle-Tongue: +2 to Provoke when creating an advantage by insulting pride, honor, or reputation.
Trial by Combat (Once/session): Njada may declare a formal spar/duel. If the target accepts, she gains +2 on her first Fight roll in that exchange.
notes: Njada is the Companions' internal pressure valve: she says what others think but won't admit, and she tests new legends the moment they walk in. She's a rival, not a villain. Her arc is learning that strength isn't only bruises; it's restraint, protection, and trust.
combat_tactics: Njada leads with Needle-Tongue taunts to create 'Shaken' or 'Rattled' advantages on enemies, then follows up with Fight or Physique-based grapples. Her Stonearm stunt makes her exceptionally dangerous in close-quarters. Trial by Combat can be used to demand personal duels, forcing enemies or rivals into advantageous ground for her. She fights with vicious efficiency and zero mercy.
social_interaction: Njada uses hostility as a first line of defense. She mocks, challenges, and provokes. She responds unexpectedly well to PC actions that demonstrate restraint under pressure — backing down from her without showing weakness earns more of her respect than matching her aggression. She apologizes through deeds, never words; if she saves your life, that's the closest you'll get to 'sorry.'

relationships.Kodlak Whitemane: Respects the Harbinger's authority; dislikes 'soft' mercy.
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Competes for 'who is the harshest' in the hall.
relationships.Elitrof Whitemane: Feels threatened by his rising myth; rivalry can become loyalty or obsession.

rivalry_with_elitrof.notes: Ticks on public triumphs or ideological clashes; resolves into Ally or Antagonist.

personality_notes.speaking_style: Blunt, abrasive, uses mockery as a reflex.
motivations: Never be the weak one again (hook)
Protect the Hall by hardening it
fears: Caring about someone and losing them
quirks: Apologizes by doing something useful, not by words

story_hooks: Njada challenges Elitrof's Purity Path publicly unless handled carefully.
She becomes a terrifying ally if you earn her respect in battle and in policy.
A Silver Hand plot tries to recruit her rivalry into sabotage.
gm_notes: Njada is the most volatile Companion but also one of the most rewarding to develop. Her rivalry clock is a campaign mechanic: tick it on every public humiliation or ideological clash, and let it resolve organically. She needs to be handled without condescension — PC players who lecture her lose ground; those who challenge her directly and then deliver gain it. Her bond quest arc centers on vulnerability: she has to choose, once, to trust instead of armoring up. Her romance arc, if pursued, is among the most emotionally complex in the Hall.
